intro: Ononis tridentata subsp. crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved sand-rocket, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its broader, more robust leaves compared to the typical form of *Ononis tridentata*. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. This plant plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local insect populations.
